Package org.jetel.util.exec

  • Interface Summary 
    Interface Description
    DataConsumer
    Interface for instances able to consume process' output and/or error output.
    DataProducer
    Interface for instances able to produce process' input.
  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    EnvironmentVariablesUtils
    A class for handling environment variable property of components SystemExecute and ExecuteShellScript
    EnvironmentVariablesUtils.EnvironmentVariable  
    EnvironmentVariablesUtils.EnvironmentVariableUpdate  
    EnvironmentVariablesUtils.ParsedAssignment  
    FileDataConsumer
    Reads data from input stream, which is supposed to be connected to process' output, and writes them using an instance of class Writer.
    LoggerDataConsumer
    Reads data from input stream, which is supposed to be connected to process' output or more usually to error output, and writes the data using logger.
    PlatformUtils
    Provides type of current platform - WINDOWS, LINUX, MAC.
    PortDataConsumer
    Reads data from input stream, which is supposed to be connected to process' output, and sends them to specified output port.
    PortDataProducer
    Reads data from input port and sends them to specified output output stream, which is supposed to be connected to process' input.
    ProcBox
    Class for running OS processes.
    ProducerConsumerExecutor
    Execute multiple produer threads, consumer threads and procces.
    StringDataConsumer
    Reads data from input stream, which is supposed to be connected to process' output or more usually to error output, and stores the data so that they may be retreived as a string.
    StringDataProducer
    Data producerer supplying a string to output stream, which is suposed to be connected to process' input.
  • Enum Summary 
    Enum Description
    EnvironmentVariablesUtils.AssignmentType  
    EnvironmentVariablesUtils.InvalidEnvironmentVariableDefinition.ErrorSource  
    PlatformUtils.PlatformType  
  • Exception Summary 
    Exception Description
    EnvironmentVariablesUtils.InvalidEnvironmentVariableDefinition
